channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: SEC and FINRA make tZero second recipient of special crypto license following controversial Prometheum approval
item.description: The approval comes amid calls from the crypto industry for regulatory clarity from the Gensler-led SEC.

item.title: Jamie Dimon says 'the worst outcome is stagflation,' a scenario he's not taking off the table
item.description: The CEO of the biggest U.S. bank says he sees a raft of inflationary forces on the horizon, including higher deficits and increased infrastructure spe...

item.title: The search is on for the next Harry Potter—a role which catapulted Daniel Radcliffe to a $110 million fortune
item.description: Millennials, prepare yourselves. A Harry Potter remake is in the works at HBO, and the search is on to find the star who will lead the series.

item.title: Wall Street Apple analysts underwhelmed by new iPhone's AI features
item.description: Apple's high stakes September launch event left some Wall Street analysts unsettled.

item.title: Bond and currency trading have fallen this quarter, says Goldman CEO
Climate change is coming for the makeup of presidential candidates—and your cosmetics
item.description: From lavender in perfume to cloves in toothpaste, the most common cosmetic ingredients are threatened by a warming planet.

item.title: Federal Reserve unveils toned-down banking regulations in victory for Wall Street
item.description: Bank CEOs led by JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon have lambasted the proposed Basel Endgame regulation since it was unveiled last year.

item.title: Oracle shares are up 12% after earnings. And another catalyst is on the horizon.
Ford files patent to collect driver data, including in-vehicle conversations, for in-car ads
item.description: System would “listen for dialogue between passengers.”

item.title: UBS trader turns bearish for next two months, worried about a 'large unwind'
item.description: UBS thinks the August comeback was "bad quality."

item.title: Consumer-products multinational Unilever reportedly exiting Russia
Salt Bae’s controversial London restaurant sees revenues fall by £4.3 million as customers cut back on £680 steaks
item.description: Nusr-Et's revenues and profits fell at its swanky Knightsbride restaurant, as group battled cost of living crisis.

item.title: Presidential debate crib sheet: U.S. economy numbers to know
item.description: Donald Trump and Vice President Kamala Harris are each trying to pitch themselves as the best candidate for the U.S. economy.

item.title: Dow hanging back as S&P and Nasdaq seek to continue stock-market rebound
